overview: The purpose of this measure is to establish an adjudication system and procedures to process fireworks infractions. [4] It also amends and establishes various definitions and penalties for fireworks offenses, including establishing heightened penalties under certain circumstances, and establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnics. [4] Creating a fireworks infractions system will allow law enforcement agencies and the judiciary to quickly and efficiently process low-level cases, while also allowing them to prioritize higher-level cases as appropriate. [3]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 to carry out the purposes of this Act. [3] This includes funds to update the judiciary information management system to implement the adjudications process established by section 2 of this Act. [3] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [3]

agency_impact: This measure will require the judiciary to implement a new adjudication system for fireworks infractions, similar to the existing traffic infraction system. [3] The Department of Law Enforcement (DLE) was concerned about a potential repeal of its ability to assist fire departments with inspections, but the amended version restores the authority of law enforcement officers to conduct inspections. [2] [4] The prosecuting attorney of the county in which the fireworks infraction occurred will represent the State at the time of trial. [3]
economic_impact: The legislature finds that the widespread use of illegal fireworks poses an extreme danger and lethal risk to public health and safety, and the cost to the community far outweighs any intrinsic benefit. [3] The court shall collect the fines imposed for violating this chapter and shall pay twenty per cent to the State and eighty per cent to the county in which the fine was imposed, which shall be expended by the county for law enforcement purposes. [3] Improved enforcement of the fireworks control laws is necessary to protect property from avoidable fire damage and the community from fire- and explosion-related injuries. [3]
policy_impact: This measure establishes a new chapter in the Hawaii Revised Statutes for the adjudication of fireworks infractions. [3] The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs amended the measure to clarify the definitions of "aerial device", "consumer fireworks", and "fireworks", and clarify the weight thresholds for certain penalties for fireworks offenses. [4] The bill also restores the authority of law enforcement officers to conduct inspections to verify compliance with fireworks laws and changes the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] [4]
